column4: Hey guys, I'm having serious issues with VNC keyboard layouts being mixed up.
if I type asdf it comes out abfh
is there a way to manually assign each key an output on ubuntu? I need to tell it what each key on my keyboard is.
Anybody know of conflicts between gnome and vncserver?
its set to US 105
but it is not working that way
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=37564 found this issue, which is the same. The bottom fix kinda worked but the s was still messed up, and the m
tried the one above it with 0 success
Is there a way to literally kit a key, click on the input it corresponds to and build your own custom keymap?
Anybody able to help with complete manual defining of keyboard layout?
what about http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=411949
didn't you check http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=2539412&postcount=4
tried that
you can type that by virtual keyboard, I think
if you can type numbers you might do CTRL+SHIFT+U and type the correponding hex values, irritating ;)
might be you could type gconf-   and the tab key
from eindows make a script that contain all what you need to execute and  exe in ubuntu ;), might be some easier way around
Tried that fix, definitely closer now. Everything but M and S are correctly mapped now. both of those seem to be pointing to the "Super" key
what does sudo apt-get install -f            do?
this might be just because you have installed a later version
I mean an older version
apparantly I had a non finished email install that caused it, thanks!
I think ssh -X does any way check man ssh
